predicate.note: Frames file for 'earmark' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to reserve or set aside for a particular purpose

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Venezuela has also earmarked $ 200 million [*U*] in new money for light-crude exploration .

example.name: transitive
example.text: The Senate voted [*-1] to authorize $ 4.5 billion [*U*] for SDI spending in the current fiscal year , but the House , [*-2] reflecting a dramatic erosion of support for the program , earmarked only $ 3.1 billion [*U*] .

example.name: passive
example.text: However , several people said that British Air might yet rejoin the bidding group and that the carrier made the statement [*-1] to answer questions from British regulators about how it plans [*-2] to use proceeds of a securities offering previously earmarked [*] for the UAL buy-out [*T*-3] .
